bib.title: Punctuation prediction in spontaneous conversations: Can we mitigate asr errors with retrofitted word embeddings?
bib.author: Augustyniak, {\L}ukasz and Szymanski, Piotr and Morzy, Miko{\l}aj and Zelasko, Piotr and Szymczak, Adrian and Mizgajski, Jan and Carmiel, Yishay and Dehak, Najim
bib.abstract: Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) systems introduce word errors, which often confuse punctuation prediction models, turning punctuation restoration into a challenging task. These errors usually take the form of homonyms. We show how retrofitting of the word embeddings on the domain-specific data can mitigate ASR errors.
